channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Study: Abortion Lobby, Media’s Claims That Mifepristone Is ‘Safer Than Tylenol’ Are Hogwash
item.description: The study’s conclusion further confirms that mifepristone hurts more women than abortionists and their media sidekicks are willing to admit.

item.title: Sen. Cory Booker expands upon historic Senate floor speech for new book, 'Stand'
item.description: Sen. Cory Booker has expanded upon his historic Senate floor speech from last month into an upcoming book.

item.title: AOC fundraises on trying to abolish ICE amid Trump's crackdown on illegal immigration
item.description: The NRCC criticized Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez for fundraising on seeking to abolish ICE.

item.title: Trump says feds to keep oversight at Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac as he takes mortgage giants public
item.description: President Trump said the federal government will retain its guarantees for and oversight of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, even as he seeks a public offe...

item.title: Jeanine Pirro sworn in as interim US attorney, pledging 'no more mercy for criminals'
item.description: Jeanine Pirro appeared alongside President Donald Trump at the White House to be sworn in as U.S. attorney for the District of Columbia on Wednesday.

item.title: Federal judge refuses to reconsider order to facilitate deportee's return to US
item.description: A federal judge denied a request from the Department of Homeland Security to reconsider a court order demanding the return of a immigrant who was depo...

item.title: The Clock Is Running Out for Covid Fraud Investigations
item.description: A bill to allow more time to track down and file charges for these massive fraud schemes is languishing in the Senate.

item.title: The Left Will Never Recover from Donald Trump
item.description: Trump has shifted the Overton window in the culture away from woke, and it’s hard to imagine it shifting all the way back.

item.title: Anheuser-Busch taps UFC’s Dana White for a new energy drink
item.description: Phorm energy launches today.

item.title: Support School Choice To Save America’s Lost Boys
item.description: An Urban Institute study reports significant benefits for male students who participated in EdChoice, Ohio’s school choice voucher program.

item.title: Investors flee GameStop following $500 million Bitcoin splurge
item.description: GameStop announced the purchase of 4,710 Bitcoins on Wednesday.

item.title: Springsteen’s Quisling Concert
item.description: Borrowed politics defeat a former rock-music hero.

item.title: James Comey, Who Should Be In Prison, Shills On Cover-Up Queen Psaki’s Show
item.description: In a grotesquely pandering interview more flaccid than Comey’s conscience, Psaki let the weaselly old Deep Stater do what he does best: lie.

item.title: How the CEO of Lumen Technologies is building the backbone of the AI economy
item.description: "We're thinking about everything completely differently. It's one of my favorite things to do. I love leading change," Johnson told Fortune.

item.title: Longtime Democrat senator's daughter takes aim at Trump, Musk, RFK Jr, in launch for key House swing seat
item.description: Stefany Shaheen, daughter of Sen. Jeanne Shaheen, announces her candidacy for New Hampshire's 1st Congressional District, focusing on healthcare advoc...

item.title: Apple has bought a game studio for the first time
item.description: Tech giant buys maker of Sneaky Sasquatch game.

item.title: Rubio urged to punish Iraq with 'maximum pressure' sanctions for its 'complete subjugation' by Iran
item.description: GOP lawmakers push for sanctions on Iraq, citing its subjugation by Iran and the need to halt U.S. aid, highlighting past policy failures and security...

item.title: The Black Death’s Economic ‘Dividend’
item.description: The week of May 19, 2025: Prosperity & population decline, tariffs, the debt, pharma, and more.

item.title: Trump’s Ominous Threat to Apple
item.description: The president of the United States is not a king whose words carry the power of law, yet businessmen have found it smart to act as though they do.

item.title: Rubio Announces Visa Restrictions For Foreign Nationals Who Censor Americans
item.description: 'The days of passive treatment for those who work to undermine the rights of Americans are over,' Rubio wrote.

item.title: Media Falls Over Itself To Defend South African President Who Claimed Genocidal Chants Were Free Speech
item.description: Despite the media's best attempt to cover, South Africa's president excused the genocidal chants as free speech.

item.title: Trump says Canada might join states in exchange for free missile defense protection
item.description: President Trump said Canada is "considering" becoming the 51st state in exchange for free protection by the proposed "Golden Dome" defense system.

item.title: Trump vows pardon for reality-star family the Chrisleys
item.description: The White House announced that reality TV stars Julie and Todd Chrisley will be receiving pardons from President Trump.

item.title: Denny’s CEO says she starts any new gig by ‘walking around with a little journal’ and asking staff the same questions
item.description: Denny’s boss used to run the ship at Chili’s and Red Lobster—she says she starts every new assignment by asking employees and customers 4 very specifi...

item.title: Tariffs, Inflation, and Returns: How Investments Respond to Supply Shocks
item.description: Learn how tariff-related inflation shocks ripple through markets—and which assets have historically helped investors navigate the turbulence.

item.title: Judge permanently halts Trump's order punishing WilmerHale
item.description: A federal judge on Tuesday struck down President Trump's order targeting the law firm of WilmerHale, warning - with Trumpian exclamation marks through...

item.title: Women in Alts: Leading with Inspiration, Intuition, and Impact
item.description: Women investors are redefining alternatives with bold leadership, values-driven decisions, and long-term impact.

item.title: The Downgrade Is Done. The Investor Response Is Just Beginning
item.description: The US downgrade won’t upend markets—but it may reshape sovereign risk models and investor assumptions. Here’s what to watch next.

item.title: Tariffs and Returns: Lessons from 150 Years of Market History
item.description: What 150 years of market data reveal about tariffs, growth, and investment returns—and how equity factors have historically delivered resilience.

item.title: Vices, Virtues, and a Little Humor: 30 Quotes from Financial History
item.description: This collection of quotes from US financial history offers timeless lessons in vice, virtue, and investing wisdom for every generation.
